page.content: { exchanged for the County of { Cornwall.After that it changed { hands frequently.At one point it { belonged to Elizabeth,Henry VII { Wife and was used as part of the { dowrys for 4 of Henry the VIII's { wives. { After them Upton Manor became { the summer palace for the Bishop { of Peterborough,William Dove.As a { point of interest a tunnel still { exists running between the garden { of Upton Manor and the chapel { grounds. { The town used to be clustered { around the chapel but now it is a { little more isolated from the { houses.The chapel is 800 years { old and was connected with the { church at Castor. {1600's The nave and bell was rebuilt. {1770 Parish registers were started to
